meanings.def: having four straight equal sides and four angles of 90°
examples: a square room

meanings.def: forming an angle of 90° exactly or approximately
examples: The book had rounded, not square, corners.
square shoulders
He had a firm, square jaw.

meanings.def: used after a number to give a measurement of area
examples: an area of 36 square metres/feet/miles/kilometres/inches

meanings.def: used after a unit of measurement to say that something measures the same amount on each of four sides
examples: a carpet four metres square

meanings.def: used to describe something that is broad or that looks solid in shape
examples: a man of square build

meanings.def: level with something or parallel to something
examples: tables arranged square with the wall

meanings.def: if two people are square, neither of them owes money to the other
examples: Here's the £10 I owe you—now we're square.

meanings.def: if two teams are square, they have the same number of points
examples: The teams were all square at half-time.

meanings.def: fair or honest, especially in business matters
examples: a square deal
Are you being square with me?

meanings.def: in agreement with something
examples: That isn't quite square with what you said yesterday.

meanings.def: considered to be boring, for example because they are old-fashioned or work too hard at school
a good meal that satisfies your hunger
examples: He looks as though he hasn't had a square meal for weeks.

meanings.def: a person who does not feel happy or comfortable in a particular situation, or who is not suitable for it

idioms.def: a good meal that satisfies your hunger
examples: He looks as though he hasn't had a square meal for weeks.

idioms.idiom: a square peg (in a round hole)
idioms.def: a person who does not feel happy or comfortable in a particular situation, or who is not suitable for it

meanings.def: a shape with four straight sides of equal length and four angles of 90°; a piece of something that has this shape
examples: First break the chocolate into squares.
The floor was tiled in squares of grey and white marble.
A square of light shone from the skylight.
Cut the sandwiches into neat squares.

meanings.def: an open area in a town, usually with four sides, surrounded by buildings
examples: The hotel is just off the main square.
the town/central/public/market square
The crowd filled the square.
the east side of the square
The next day, a large crowd gathered in the market square.

meanings.def: the number obtained when you multiply a number by itself
examples: The square of 7 is 49.

meanings.def: a person who is considered to be boring, for example because they are old-fashioned or because they work too hard at school
a return to the situation you were in at the beginning of a project, task, etc., because you have made no real progress
examples: If this suggestion isn't accepted, we'll be back to square one.

idioms.def: a return to the situation you were in at the beginning of a project, task, etc., because you have made no real progress
examples: If this suggestion isn't accepted, we'll be back to square one.

meanings.def: to make something have straight edges and corners
examples: The boat is rounded at the front but squared off at the back.

meanings.def: to multiply a number by itself
examples: Three squared is written 32.
Four squared equals 16.

meanings.def: to make your back and shoulders straight to show you are ready or determined to do something
examples: Bruno squared himself to face the waiting journalists.

meanings.def: to make the number of points you have scored in a game or competition equal to those of your opponents
examples: His goal squared the game 1–1.

meanings.def: to pay money to somebody in order to get their help
examples: They must have squared the mayor before they got their plan underway.

meanings.def: to do something that is considered to be impossible
examples: Marketing companies are trying to square the circle of profitability and growth with strong ethical values and sustainability.

idioms.def: to do something that is considered to be impossible
examples: Marketing companies are trying to square the circle of profitability and growth with strong ethical values and sustainability.

meanings.def: directly; not at an angle
examples: I looked her square in the face.
He hit me square on the jaw.

meanings.def: honestly and according to the rules
examples: We won the election fair and square.

meanings.def: exactly in the place you were aiming for
examples: I hit the target fair and square.

idioms.idiom: fair and square | fairly and squarely
idioms.def: honestly and according to the rules
examples: We won the election fair and square.
I hit the target fair and square.
